title: They Fell Deeply in Love in Bucha. One Russian Bullet Ended It All.
description: Over nearly two decades, Iryna Abramova and her husband, Oleh, built a life of love and happiness. Now, she says, she wishes the Russian soldiers had shot her, too.

title: Live Updates: West Works to Put Ukraine Pledges Into Action
description: Europe was discussing moving away from Russian energy sources, while in Washington, the Senate was expected soon to take up President Biden’s $33 billion aid package for Ukraine. Speaker Nancy Pelosi, visiting Poland, said Russia’s war required the “strongest possible” response.

title: Sisters Recount Escape From Mariupol as Russians Closed In
description: The women say they were forced onto a bus to Russian-controlled territory, then escaped what Ukrainian and U.S. officials have described as “filtration” centers for a system of forced expulsions to Russia.

title: Inside China’s Zero-Covid Fortress, Xi Jinping Admits No Doubts
description: As the lockdown of Shanghai and outbreaks in Beijing and elsewhere batter the economy, China’s leader keeps a distance from the politically charged issue.

title: Bangladesh Shutters Dozens of Schools Set Up by Rohingya in Camps
description: More than 30 schools, teaching tens of thousands of Rohingya students, were closed in Bangladesh, where officials are said to have feared the schools would encourage the refugees to stay permanently.

title: Ahead of Philippines Election, Young People Rally Around Leni Robredo
description: As the election in the Philippines nears, tens of thousands of young people who fear another Marcos presidency are rallying around Leni Robredo, the country’s vice president.

title: Spain Says Cellphones of Prime Minister and Defense Minister Were Hacked
description: Officials said the devices were breached by the Pegasus spyware, made by an Israeli company, which is intended to track illegal behavior but has been misused by some governments.

title: Pakistani Airstrikes Escalate Conflict on Afghan Border
description: The airstrikes killed at least 45 people, stoking fears of a violent resurgence of the conflict in eastern Afghanistan, which has become a base for Pakistani militants.

title: In Hong Kong, Cheap Dining Options Are All the Rage
description: In a city pummeled by political upheaval, economic downturn and the pandemic, bare-bones ‘two dishes and rice’ restaurants have become a go-to destination across all social classes.

title: U.K. Plan to Send Asylum Seekers to Rwanda Stokes Anger and Dread
description: The government’s proposal has led to recriminations from rights groups, and anxiety among migrants who fear being sent away.

description: The war in Ukraine is so big that it has shaken the world. But for a sister looking for her missing older brother, it was reduced to a visit to a morgue.

title: She Promised to Empower Women. Will Honduras’s President Succeed?
description: The country’s first female leader, Xiomara Castro, is struggling to advance her feminist agenda 14 years after a coup ended the presidency of her husband, who pursued similar causes.

title: Mi’ilya, Christian Village in Israel, Digs Into Crusader Past
description: The residents of Mi’ilya long wondered what archaeological treasures lay beneath a crumbling castle. Now, some are excavating their homes to find out.

description: Russia tries to gain ground in Ukraine’s east.
